text: Frank Owen Gehry (born Frank Owen Goldberg; February 28, 1929) is a Canadian- American architect who won the Pritzker Prize in 1989. He is known for his buildings such as 8 Spruce Street, Dancing House, Port Olímpic, Jay Pritzker Pavilion, Guggenheim Museum Bilbao and the Walt Disney Concert Hall. He built buildings across the United States and across South America. ==Early life== Gehry was born on February 28, 1929 in Toronto, Ontario, Canada to Polish- Jewish parents. He was raised in Los Angeles, California. He studied at Los Angeles City College and at the University of Southern California.Biography and Video Interview of Frank Gehry at Academy of Achievement Gehry now lives in Santa Monica, California. ==Career== In 1989, Gehry won the Pritzker Prize.Pritzker Architecture Prize, "Frank Gehry, 198 Laureate"; retrieved 2013-3-27. he built the Maggie cancer card center in Scotland ==References== ==Other websites== *Gehry Partners, LLP , Gehry's architecture firm *Gehry Technologies, Inc., Gehry's technology firm *Profile at the Pritzker Prize *Fish Forms: Lamps by Frank Gehry Exhibition (2010) at The Jewish Museum (New York) *STORIES OF HOUSES: Frank Gehry's House in California *Bidding for the National Art Museum of China’s new site Category:1929 births Category:Living people Category:American architects Category:American Jews Category:Businesspeople from California Category:Canadian businesspeople Category:Canadian Jews Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:People from Santa Monica, California Category:People from Toronto Category:Pritzker Architecture Prize winners
title: Frank Gehry
